ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: For a student of Italian literature at Yale this class is essential.

I would call the class a fast-paced, challenging look at the 20th century Italian novel. I would definitely recommend it to anyone that wants a better grasp of the era's literature (and practice using Italian in a scholarly setting).
I would recommend, if they speak Italian

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This is an essential introduction to an important phase in Italian literature.

The course definitely gave me a taste of 20th century literature, and pushed me to be interested in other authors and other works of the period. It was also interesting to relate the development of the novel to developments in literature in past centuries.
